id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

default.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: default run duration for timer wakeup and any unspecified wakeup reason.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

touch_wakeup_reason.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: run duration if woken up by touch.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

gpio_wakeup_reason.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: run duration if woken up by GPIO.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

run_duration.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time duration the node should be active, i.e. run code.Only on ESP32, instead of time, it is possible to specify run duration according to the wakeup reason from deep-sleep:
  * **default** (**Required**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): default run duration for timer wakeup and any unspecified wakeup reason.
  
  * **gpio_wakeup_reason** (*Optional*, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): run duration if woken up by GPIO.
  
  * **touch_wakeup_reason** (*Optional*, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): run duration if woken up by touch.
  
  

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

sleep_duration.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time duration to stay in deep sleep mode.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

wakeup_pin.docs:
**[Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: Only on ESP32. A pin to wake up to once in deep sleep mode. Use the inverted property to wake up to LOW signals.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

wakeup_pin_mode.docs:
Only on ESP32. Specify how to handle waking up from a `wakeup_pin` if the wakeup pin is already in the state with which it would wake up when attempting to enter deep sleep. See [ESP32 Wakeup Pin Mode](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-esp32-wakeup-pin-mode). Defaults to `IGNORE`

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

pins.docs:
**list of pin numbers**: The pins to wake up on.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

mode.docs:
The mode to use for the wakeup source. Must be one of `ALL_LOW` (wake up when all pins go LOW) or `ANY_HIGH` (wake up when any pin goes HIGH).

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

esp32_ext1_wakeup.docs:
Use the EXT1 wakeup source of the ESP32 to wake from deep sleep to wake up on multiple pins. This cannot be used together with wakeup pin.
  * **pins** (**Required**, list of pin numbers): The pins to wake up on.
  
  * **mode** (**Required**): The mode to use for the wakeup source. Must be one of `ALL_LOW` (wake up when all pins go LOW) or `ANY_HIGH` (wake up when any pin goes HIGH).
  
  

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

touch_wakeup.docs:
**boolean**: Only on ESP32. Use a touch event to wakeup from deep sleep. To be able to wakeup from a touch event, [Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/esp32_touch.html#esp32-touch-binary-sensor) must be configured properly.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#configuration-variables)*

sleep_duration.docs:
**[templatable](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-templatable), [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The time duration to stay in deep sleep mode.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-enter-action)*

until.docs:
**string**: The time of day to wake up. Only on ESP32.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-enter-action)*

time_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the time component to use for the `until` option. Only on ESP32.

*See also: [Deep Sleep Component](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-enter-action)*

enter.docs:
This action makes the given deep sleep component enter deep sleep immediately.

*See also: [`deep_sleep.enter` Action](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-enter-action)*

allow.docs:
This action allows the given deep sleep component to enter deep sleep, after previously being prevented.

*See also: [`deep_sleep.allow` Action](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-allow-action)*

prevent.docs:
This action prevents the given deep sleep component from entering deep sleep. Useful for keeping the ESP active during data transfer or OTA updating (See note below for more information).

*See also: [`deep_sleep.prevent` Action](https://esphome.io/components/deep_sleep.html#deep-sleep-prevent-action)*
